com.db.chart.view

Class AxisController

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.db.chart.view.AxisController
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    XController, YController

    public abstract class AxisController
extends java.lang.Object
    Class responsible to control vertical measures, positions, yadda yadda. If the drawing is requested it will also take care of it.

    • Method Detail

      • setAxisLabelsSpacing

        public void setAxisLabelsSpacing(float spacing)

      • setBorderValues

        public void setBorderValues(int minValue,
                            int maxValue,
                            int step)
        A step is seen as the step to be defined between 2 labels. As an example a step of 2 with a maxAxisValue of 6 will end up with {0, 2, 4, 6} as labels.
        Parameters:
        minValue - The minimum value that Y axis will have as a label
        maxValue - The maximum value that Y axis will have as a label
        step - (real) value distance from every label

      • setBorderValues

        public void setBorderValues(int minValue,
                            int maxValue)
        Parameters:
        minValue - The minimum value that Y axis will have as a label
        maxValue - The maximum value that Y axis will have as a label

      • draw

        protected abstract void draw(android.graphics.Canvas canvas)
        Method called from onDraw method to draw AxisController data.
        Parameters:
        canvas - Canvas to use while drawing the data
